intro: Desmotrichum ardenii, commonly known as the Cape York daisy, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
